text: Hemipristis serra is an extinct species of weasel shark that lived in Oligocene to Miocene epochs. It estimates in 7 meters (22.9 ft) in lenght of maximum body size. It's lived in South Florida, Mexico. The species was originaly named as Hemipristis paucidens by Louis Agassiz in 1835, but It synomized in 1902 a junior synonym of this species by Hay. == References == Category:Sharks Category:Miocene Category:Oligocene Category:Extinct fish Category:Florida Category:Mexico Category:United States
title: Hemipristis serra
